question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes. Implement an SEO analysis tool that allows users to input a website URL, and the tool automatically detects SEO metrics (such as keyword density, meta tags, link structure, etc.) and generates a detailed analysis report.

checklist.title: Is the URL input and validation system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes proper URL validation (supporting various formats including http/https, subdomains, and query parameters), error handling for invalid URLs, and appropriate user feedback. Score 0 if URL validation is missing, 5 if basic validation exists but edge cases aren't handled, and 10 if comprehensive validation with informative error messages is implemented.

checklist.title: Is the web scraping/crawling functionality robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can effectively retrieve website content with proper error handling for server errors, timeouts, and robots.txt compliance. Check for rate limiting mechanisms, proxy support, and handling of JavaScript-rendered content. Deduct 5 points if the crawler doesn't respect robots.txt, 3 points if there's no timeout handling, and 3 points if JS-rendered content isn't properly processed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are key SEO metrics comprehensively analyzed?
checklist.description: Review whether the tool analyzes essential SEO elements including meta tags (title, description, keywords), heading structure (H1-H6), keyword density analysis, image alt attributes, canonical links, content-to-HTML ratio, and mobile responsiveness. Award 10 points for analyzing all these elements thoroughly, 5 points for covering only basic metrics, and 0 points if critical metrics are missing.

checklist.title: Is the link structure analysis feature complete?
checklist.description: Assess whether the tool can detect, categorize and analyze internal links, external links, broken links, anchor text quality, and link depth. Check if the tool can generate a visual site structure map. Deduct 3 points if broken link detection is missing, 3 points if there's no anchor text analysis, and 5 points if no visual representation of link structure is provided. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as unreachable websites, malformed HTML, CORS issues, network interruptions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Competitor comparison 2. Historical SEO performance tracking 3. AI-powered content optimization suggestions 4. Automated schema markup validation). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar analysis functions (e.g., multiple keyword density analyzers) 2. Function modules unrelated to SEO analysis (e.g., a built-in social media manager) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down report generation). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating crawling/analysis/reporting layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size â‰¥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the report visualization effective and actionable?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SEO report is presented in a clear, actionable format: 1) Data visualization using appropriate charts/graphs 2) Priority-based issue highlighting 3) Specific improvement recommendations with examples 4) Export functionality in multiple formats. Deduct 3 points for missing visualizations, 5 points if recommendations are vague or generic, and 5 points if the report lacks exportability. The full score is 10 points.
